content.description:
A power endurance test piece. Sit start with your hands crossed. Heel hook near your hand and power up right to a sloping ledge. Continue right hand to a decent sloper ledge. Sink a heel on the upper start hold and make a big move to a ledge side pull with an indent. Take a breath and prepare for the crux. Find a way to cross up and over to the next ledge which faces the wrong direction, then adjust your feet holding maximum tension. Bust to the lip saving strength for a topout that could spit you off.

Left side of severe overhang

Start low on a good jug. Make a big move up and left. Get your heel hooking on to reach a bad crimp. Either be insanely strong and match the crimp or bump your right hand to a sloper dish right below the lip. Figure out your feet and topout.

Located on the opposite side of the severe overhang. To get there, follow the trail near Major League boulder around to the backside of Color of Time.

Start on two seperate crimps and make a couple moves to reach the crux. Pull around the bulge and make your way onto the slab headwall. Continue to the top

Located on the opposite side of the severe overhang. To get there, follow the trail near Major League boulder around to the backside of Color of Time. On the Leftmost side.

A boulder problem that needed to be climbed. Stand start with the left hand on the lowest part of a good ledge above your head, specifically within two hand lengths from the start of the ledge. The right hand on the undercling ledge below it. Campus or try and paste a foot to move up and right utilizing lots of footwork. Decent holds lead to a committing top out. A must-do for anyone that can climb V5 or harder. View photos for better judgement on the left hand start. It has come to light that some may have used a big pad stack to move the left hand higher on the starting sloper ledge. I'm not unopposed to pad stacking if you are to short to reach the starting hold or the foot that people use but using a pad stack to move your hand way up the rail is cheating. This completely eliminates the first move crux and subsequently should not be considered a genuine send.


On the right side of the severe overhang. Locate a giant sloper rail.

Amazing boulder hosting two of the best climbs we have developed so far. Color of Time (V9) could be a classic boulder anywhere in the world and Performance Anxiety (V5) is without doubt another amazing line.
